text: BEIRUT, Aug 12 The Lebanese government will discuss a draft law allowing the central bank to use its mandatory reserve to continue to finance subsidised fuel imports after Governor Riad Salameh met President Michel Aoun on Thursday, a ministerial source said.Salameh had refused to retreat from the central banks decision to effectively halt the subsidies without such legislation, saying that he required a law to use the mandatory reserve, the source said.The caretaker government is due to meet later on Thursday. (Writing by Tom Perry; Editing by Jon Boyle)
